dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Where the UK’s ISA millionaires are investing
News Content: The number of investors with £1 million or more in their stocks and shares individual savings account (ISA) is on the rise, according to Hargreaves Lansdown's (HL.L) platform data, which revealed where they are putting their money.

The UK's biggest investment platform said there were 1,322 "ISA millionaires" on its platform as of the end of December.

The figure was up 14% over the previous six months alone and was much higher when compared to the 168 ISA millionaires on the platform seven years ago, with just three recorded in 2012.

HL found that the average age of an ISA millionaire on its platform was now 72 years old, down from 74 six months ago. However, the gender split of ISA millionaires had not changed from two years ago, with just over two-thirds found to be men.

"Some people get into investment in the hope of getting rich quick, but the vast majority of ISA millionaires have built a fortune through the far more reliable approach of getting rich slow," said Kate Marshall, lead investment analyst at HL.

Read more: Key investment themes to watch in 2025

"They don’t necessarily take enormous risks: many consistently invest as much as possible of their annual allowance, in a diverse and balanced portfolio, every year, for decades."

Marshall pointed out that the top 10 stocks bought by this group were dominated by UK-listed blue-chip companies, including those that have traditionally paid strong dividends.

"It means most of them aren’t speculating," she said. "They’re not in a hurry to trade them regularly either as, while most ISA millionaires traded in 2024, this has tended to be infrequent."

As for the most bought funds, Marshall said ISA millionaires were investing in a broad international mix of popular funds. Half of these funds were focused on a diversified mix of global companies, though there were also a couple of UK funds on the list, including an income fund.

"This reflects that as investors get older, some of the portfolio may have been reconfigured for income," she said.

"When you have a larger portfolio, you have more scope to add specialist funds into the mix, which is why we see a technology and India fund in the list of popular investments. Investors with a larger portfolio may be willing to take more risks, partly as they may have more scope for loss, or have sufficient stores of value elsewhere, such as cash ISAs, savings accounts, or annuities."

Here's more detail on which were the most popular stocks and funds with HL's ISA millionaires.

Story Continues

Legal & General Group (LGEN.L)

Financial services company Legal & General Group was one name on the list, despite its shares trading nearly 8% in the red on a one-year basis.

In December, the firm said it was planning to return capital to investors and was on track to meet financial targets. L&G said it was on track to deliver mid-single digital growth in operating profit for the 2024 fiscal year, in line with guidance

Operating profit in its half-year results came in at £920m ($1.14bn), slightly below the £924m it delivered in the first half of 2023. Profit after tax attributable to shareholders was down 41% to £223m.

However, L&G raised its half-year dividend by 5% to 6p per share. The company's full-year results are due out on 12 March.

•USD

(LGEN.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

BP (BP.L)

Another big name on the list was BP, though shares in the oil major are down nearly 10% on a one-year basis.

In October, BP posted its weakest quarterly profit in nearly four years. The oil major reported a nearly 30% slump in underlying replacement cost profit to $2.3bn (£1.85bn) in the third quarter. Underlying replacement cost profit is the metric BP uses as its version of net income.

BP attributed the fall in net income in the third quarter to factors such as weaker realised refining margins and a poor oil trading result.

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

Despite worse quarterly results, BP announced a share buyback of $1.75bn as part of its commitment to announce $3.5bn in purchases in the second half of the year. BP also declared a dividend of $0.08 per share, though that is still much lower than its peak payout of $0.105.

Oil prices have been under pressure over concerns about weaker demand and geopolitical tensions, which has pushed brent crude (BZ=F) back below $78 per barrel.

BP's fourth quarter results and its latest dividend announcement are due out on 11 February.

•USD

(BP.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

Rio Tinto (RIO.L)

Miner Rio Tinto also made HL's list of the most-bought stocks by ISA millionaires. While the stock is down nearly 12% over the past year, it recently ticked up slightly on reports that it had been in talks with Glencore (GLEN.L) about a potential merger, though discussions were said to no longer be active.

In its recently released fourth quarter production results, Rio Tinto said its mined copper production was up 13% in 2024 on the previous year.

CEO Jakob Stausholm said in an interview with the Financial Times last week that US president Donald Trump will give the green light to the company's copper mine in Arizona.

"I do think that we have really good chances now to progress that project," he said. It comes after a long battle over permits for the mine.

The Resolution mine would be the biggest copper mine in North America once completed, capable of producing as much as 25% of US copper demand each year.

•USD

(RIO.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

ISA millionaire top funds

Five Legal & General Investment Management (LGIM) index funds were among those most bought by HL's ISA millionaires.

This included the Legal & General Global Technology Index Trust (0P000023MW.L), which tracks the performance of the FTSE World – Technology index.

The £3.8bn fund is up nearly 38% over the past year, with its top holdings including iPhone maker Apple (AAPL) and chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA).

Another popular fund with ISA millionaires was Jupiter India (0P0000U20R.L), which has delivered a return of 24% over one year. This return was ahead of its target benchmark of the 13% return from the MSCI India index with net dividends re-invested.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

The biggest sectors the fund is allocated to are financials and healthcare. Its biggest holdings include tobacco manufacturer Godfrey Phillips India (GODFRYPHLP.NS) and private hospital network Fortis Healthcare (FORTIS.NS).

Artemis Income (0P0000KKC3.L), which invests in UK companies, was also named on HL's list. The fund has produced a return of 15% over one year, beating the FTSE All-Share's (0P00000CNT.L) 9.5%.

Financials also make up the biggest share of sector exposure in this fund, followed by consumer discretionary and staples firms.

Top holdings include Pearson (PSON.L), which provides educational materials and technology, along with private equity investment trust 3i Group (III.L).

Read more:

6 crypto developments in 2025 that will keep fuelling bitcoin's rally Best fund picks for investing in a Trump 2.0 presidency Five ways to save on the cost of having children

Download the Yahoo Finance app, available for Apple and Android.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights a growing trend of ISA millionaires investing in blue-chip companies, including technology stocks like Apple. The mention of Apple in the context of a successful technology fund suggests a positive sentiment towards the company. Additionally, the overall trend of ISA millionaires indicates a preference for stable, long-term investments rather than speculative trading, which could bode well for established companies like Apple. However, the news does not provide any specific catalysts that would directly impact Apple's stock price in the short term. Therefore, while there is a positive sentiment, the lack of immediate triggers leads to a moderate probability of price rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. On one hand, Buffett's significant reduction in Apple holdings due to overvaluation and potential tax increases is a negative signal. His shift towards Domino's, a value stock, further reinforces this concern. Geopolitical risks and antitrust issues also weigh on Apple's near-term prospects. However, upcoming product releases (iPhone 16, Apple Watch Series 10, AirPods 4) and the adoption of Apple Intelligence offer potential for revenue and earnings growth. Morgan Stanley's forecast of revenue growth and EPS for 2026 provides a positive counterpoint. Considering these factors, the negative signals from Buffett's actions and the overvaluation concerns slightly outweigh the positive catalysts, leading to a higher probability of a price fall.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news headline focuses on a prediction of Apple reaching a $4 trillion valuation by 2025,  a prediction unrelated to any specific news about Apple itself. The article's title highlights skepticism towards this prediction.  The core information is that Apple is Warren Buffett's largest holding and is close to a $4 trillion valuation. While a $4 trillion valuation implies significant future growth, the news itself doesn't provide any new information about Apple's performance or prospects that would directly cause a stock price movement.  Therefore, the probability of a price rise or fall due to this news alone is low.  Market movements are influenced by many factors beyond this single news item.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL) and the broader AI PC market. Cramer highlighted concerns about consumer demand for AI PCs, noting that a Morgan Stanley survey indicated weak consumer interest in paying extra for AI features. While Cramer remains bullish on enterprise AI applications, his skepticism about the consumer AI PC super cycle could negatively impact sentiment around Apple, given its reliance on consumer electronics. Additionally, the mention of Apple's iPhone struggling in China adds to the negative sentiment. However, Cramer also downplays the impact of consensus estimates, suggesting that the market may already be pricing in some negative expectations. Overall, the negative aspects of the news outweigh the positives, leading to a higher probability of a stock price fall.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The article discusses Apple's upcoming earnings report and its potential impact on the stock price. Apple's stock has had a rough start in 2025, down 8% and underperforming the S&P 500. The earnings and sales revisions have been primarily unchanged, with an expected 8% growth in EPS and 3.7% growth in top line year-over-year. Key metrics to watch include Apple's China results, Services segment, and iPhone sales, particularly the adoption rate and use of Apple Intelligence. The stock currently has a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell), indicating bearishness among analysts. Given the mixed expectations and the stock's recent underperformance, there is a slightly higher likelihood of the stock price falling than rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article discusses the Q3 earnings of various consumer electronics companies, including Apple. Apple's revenue was up 6.1% year over year, exceeding analysts' expectations by 0.5%. However, the Services segment missed revenue expectations. Despite this mixed quarter, the stock is up 2% since the results. Considering the overall positive trend in the consumer electronics sector and Apple's ability to top operating income expectations, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.0, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.0, Reasoning: The provided news headline 'What Does Berkshire Hathaway Own?' does not contain specific information related to Apple Inc. It appears to be a general query or title, likely referring to an article or report detailing Berkshire Hathaway's holdings. Without additional context or details about Berkshire Hathaway's position in Apple, it is impossible to determine how this news would affect Apple's stock price.

I will stick to my original assessment and slightly adjust the probabilities based on the previous rounds.

The article itself expresses skepticism towards this prediction. While Apple's position as Warren Buffett's largest holding is positive, the news lacks specific catalysts for short-term price movement.  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, highlighting the uncertainty surrounding Apple's near-term prospects. Some models highlight positive factors like potential product releases and revenue growth, while others emphasize concerns about overvaluation, geopolitical risks, and weakening consumer demand.  Given the lack of concrete news directly affecting Apple and the conflicting predictions, I assign a near-even probability to both price rise and fall.  The long-term $4 trillion valuation prediction is too far out to significantly influence short-term probabilities.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news highlights a growing trend of ISA millionaires investing in blue-chip companies, including technology stocks like Apple. This suggests a positive sentiment towards stable, long-term investments, which could bode well for established companies like Apple. However, there are mixed signals from previous predictions, with some analysts citing concerns about overvaluation and geopolitical risks. The overall trend of ISA millionaires indicates a preference for reliable investments, which may support a positive outlook for Apple. Therefore, while there are some negative signals, the general trend of increased investment in blue-chip stocks leads to a higher probability of price rise compared to fall.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Where the UK’s ISA millionaires are investing",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.55,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.45
}
```
